comment: There exists a unique set equal to a given set. Special case of ~ eueqi proved using only predicate calculus. The proof needs ` y = z ` be free of ` x ` . This is ensured by having ` x ` and ` y ` be distinct. Alternately, a distinctor ` -. A. x x = y ` could have been used instead. See ~ eueq and ~ eueqi for classes. (Contributed by Stefan Allan, 4-Dec-2008.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 8-Sep-2019.) Reduce axiom usage. (Revised by Wolf Lammen, 1-Mar-2023.)
